***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*Flame redirects here. For the wand, see [wand of flame](/Wand_of_flame "Wand of flame"). For the removed card, see [Flame card](/Flame_card "Flame card")*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                 |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | It burns victims, dealing an additional one-quarter of any damage that pierces defenders' armour. Big, fiery blades are also staple armaments of hydra-hunters. |

The **flaming** [brand](/Brand "Brand") does the following:

- Adds an average of roughly +25% [fire](/Fire "Fire") damage (0% - 50%) to attacks, applied after [AC](/AC "AC") and all damage factors (including [slaying](/Slaying "Slaying")).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- When an edged weapon of flaming ([Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades"), [Axes](/Axes "Axes"), 2-handed [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms"), [lajatangs](/Lajatang "Lajatang")) cuts [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra") heads, flaming will cauterize the wound, preventing the hydra from regrowing heads, for a net loss of 1 head.

## Contents

- [1 Sources](#Sources)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Sources

Along with finding flaming weapons as random loot, or using a [scroll of brand weapon](/Scroll_of_brand_weapon "Scroll of brand weapon"), flaming can be found on a few monsters:

- [Efreets](/Efreet "Efreet"), as well as the uniques [Erica](/Erica "Erica") and [Azrael](/Azrael "Azrael"), often carry [scimitars](/Scimitar "Scimitar") of flaming.
- [Fire giants](/Fire_giant "Fire giant") usually generate with flaming [great swords](/Great_sword "Great sword").
- [Nessos](/Nessos "Nessos") is always generated with a flaming [longbow](/Longbow "Longbow").
- [Trog](/Trog "Trog") often gifts weapons of flaming.

## Strategy

Flaming is one of a couple percentage-based brands that's good enough to beat a 3-rune game. For edged-weapon users, flaming is very desirable against hydras, who are often difficult to take out otherwise.

As flaming applies its percentage boost after AC reduction, it is no better or worse when considering strength, weapon type, slaying, or AC. An [executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") of freezing receives the same +25% boost to final damage as a [quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade") of freezing. It's just that a quick blade's base damage is weak, so a brand like [electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") or [pain](/Pain_\(brand\) "Pain (brand)") will be stronger for it.

## History

- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), you could temporarily apply a flaming brand to your (unbranded) weapon with the spell [Fire Brand](/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand"), which could be made permanent with a [scroll of vorpalize weapon](/Scroll_of_vorpalize_weapon "Scroll of vorpalize weapon"). Also, [ranged weapons](/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon") had the "flame" brand, which was identical other than its name.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [attack.cc:1585](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/attack.cc#L1585) (0.30.1)  
   Specifically, if you dealt damage, flaming adds `(1d<damage_dealt>/2) + 0.5` fire damage, rounded down. Therefore, flaming's boost is slightly bigger than 25%. This is more noticeable on weak attacks, e.g. if you dealt 1 damage, you'd always get +1 flaming damage (for an average of +100%).

Flaming

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Flame redirects here. For the wand, see wand of flame. For the removed card, see Flame card

It burns victims, dealing an additional one-quarter of any damage that pierces defenders' armour. Big, fiery blades are also staple armaments of hydra-hunters.

The flaming brand does the following:

  • Adds an average of roughly +25% fire damage (0% - 50%) to attacks, applied after AC and all damage factors (including slaying).[1]
  • When an edged weapon of flaming (Long Blades, Axes, 2-handed Polearms, lajatangs) cuts hydra heads, flaming will cauterize the wound, preventing the hydra from regrowing heads, for a net loss of 1 head.

Contents

  • 1 Sources
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

Sources

Along with finding flaming weapons as random loot, or using a scroll of brand weapon, flaming can be found on a few monsters:

  • Efreets, as well as the uniques Erica and Azrael, often carry scimitars of flaming.
  • Fire giants usually generate with flaming great swords.
  • Nessos is always generated with a flaming longbow.
  • Trog often gifts weapons of flaming.

Strategy

Flaming is one of a couple percentage-based brands that's good enough to beat a 3-rune game. For edged-weapon users, flaming is very desirable against hydras, who are often difficult to take out otherwise.

As flaming applies its percentage boost after AC reduction, it is no better or worse when considering strength, weapon type, slaying, or AC. An executioner's axe of freezing receives the same +25% boost to final damage as a quick blade of freezing. It's just that a quick blade's base damage is weak, so a brand like electrocution or pain will be stronger for it.

History

  • Prior to 0.15, you could temporarily apply a flaming brand to your (unbranded) weapon with the spell Fire Brand, which could be made permanent with a scroll of vorpalize weapon. Also, ranged weapons had the "flame" brand, which was identical other than its name.

References

  1. ↑ attack.cc:1585 (0.30.1)
    Specifically, if you dealt damage, flaming adds (1d<damage_dealt>/2) + 0.5 fire damage, rounded down. Therefore, flaming's boost is slightly bigger than 25%. This is more noticeable on weak attacks, e.g. if you dealt 1 damage, you'd always get +1 flaming damage (for an average of +100%).
